meanings.definition: A unit of currency in the Gambia and Sierra Leone.
meanings.sent1: In the Gambia, people use bututs to buy goods.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for bututs when I visited Sierra Leone.
meanings.sent3: The bututs in my pocket jingled as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her savings were like a pile of shiny bututs, each one representing hard work.
meanings.sent5: The bututs were so tiny, they almost looked like toy coins.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with the head or horns.
meanings.sent1: The ram bututs the fence to show dominance.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally bututs his head on the low doorway.
meanings.sent3: The soccer player bututs the ball with his forehead for a goal.
meanings.sent4: The boxer bututs his opponent with a powerful headbutt.
meanings.sent5: The goat bututs the tree to knock down some leaves for a snack.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden movement or sound.
meanings.sent1: The cat bututs out of the room when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She bututs up from her seat when the phone rang.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel bututs across the yard, surprising the birds.
meanings.sent4: The balloon bututs and pops, startling everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunder bututs through the quiet night, making everyone jump.
